msg:
Merge pull request #8 from ishepard/static-analysis

Static analysis is now enabled in PyDriller. The modification object carries information about LOC, complexity, token count, and list of methods. For each method, more information are available (like starting and ending line, complexity, LOC, fan in and out, etc. )

msg:
Implements functionality requested in issue #71.

In short, this commit adds a "clone_repo_to" option to allow a user
to provide a directory in which to place clone a remote repo. This
enables the user to access the files within that directory that
aren't altered by a specific commit.

A corresponding test has also been added.
author: James Goodwin

msg:
A couple of modifications to the previous commit for issue #71.

Also simplified function call in test.

msg:
Add Delta Maintainability Model metrics

Extend Commit class with three new properties

- dmm_unit_size
- dmm_unit_complexity
- dmm_unit_interfacing

Helper methods are implemented in the Modifications class as well.

The corresponding test class provides full branch coverage, using a dedicated
git test repository.

See also Marco di Biase, Ayushi Rastogi, Magiel Bruntink, and Arie van Deursen. The Delta Maintainability Model: measuring maintainability of fine-grained code changes. IEEE/ACM International Conference on Technical Debt (TechDebt) at ICSE 2019, pp 113-122
author: Arie van Deursen

msg: Document the new DMM functionality
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Move low-risk method predicate to Method class.

Also:
- Use enum to identify the type of DMM property (size, complexity, interfacing)
- Add reference to documentation for thresholds.
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Resolve None-related mypy warnings

Make the optional nature of the Commit metric instance variable explicit.

Inform mypy (and the developer) that "calculate_metrics" ensures
metrics are not None anymore by means of an assertion.
author: Arie van Deursen

msg: Resolve mypy issues by adding annotations
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Resolve mypy warnings in RepositoryMining constructor

Public  API constructor arguments `only_modifications_with_file_types` and
`only_commits` take an List as input, but are transformed in the implementation
into a set.

MyPy did not like that the same variable was  used  for  the set and the list.
Introduced a separate one to document the conversion more explicitly.

The alternative option would be to change the public API into expecting
a set rather than a List[str].
author: Arie van Deursen

msg: Fix incorrect type annotation
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Rename TEST_DATA variable when re-used to resolve (mypy) typing

The TEST_DATA vaiable was used with different types, assigned
first with just a string tuple, and later with a mixed string/date tuple.

Resolved by using different variables for the different purposes.

With this change, all process metrics test cases pass the mypy type checking.
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Make variable type annotations python 3.5 compatible

Variable type annotations were introduced in Python 3.6.
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0526/

To keep PyDriller compatiable with Python 3.5, switch to
old-school comment-based type annotations instead.
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Ignore changes in unsupported languages in DMM

Commits can contain modificiations in languages not supported by Lizard.
Such changes should be ignored when computing the delta maintainability metrics.

We add a predicate to Modifications checking whether the programming language used
is supported (this is an extension of the public API), implemented by a call to Lizard.

If none of the modifications of a commit is written in a supported language,
the dmm value returned becomes None (this makes the return type Optional[Float]
instead of just Float).
author: Arie van Deursen

msg:
Properly handle zero-change modifications in DMM

Let the DMM proportion of good over (good+bad) change yield "None"
if the (good+bad) change equals zero (until now, 1.0 was returned instead).

Also undo the special treatment of the case in which
delta_high < 0 and delta_high = 0
to make the pydriller implementation fully consisten with the published paper.

Update documentation and tests accordingly.
author: Arie van Deursen
